g2:c.FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: The items below are used by the Visual Basic demonstration files shipped with G2-ActiveXLink. Load the VB project into VB and run it. Once a connection is established, you can push the Cycle Lights button below to illustrate starting VB functions remotely.

The items below are used by the Visual Basic 5.0, Excel 97 and Internet Explorer 3.x demonstration files shipped with G2-ActiveXLink. Load any of these demos into their respective containers and push any of the push-buttons to illustrate starting/calling of G2 procedures remotely.

g2:Sequence.rdf:li: Now you can quickly integrate your G2 application with desktop applications via Visual Basic, Visual Basic for Applications, VBScript and C++!
G2-ActiveXLink control may be dropped into Microsoft Office 97, Visual Basic 5.0, Internet Explorer 3.0 or any COM container.
Now you can quickly integrate your G2 application with desktop applications via Visual Basic, Visual Basic for Applications, VBScript and C++!
G2-ActiveXLink control may be dropped into Microsoft Office 97, Visual Basic 5.0, Internet Explorer 3.0 or any COM container.
